{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3050245,"name":"Kan S","username":"mochihammer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mochihammer/{size}/256848_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-24T03:55:52.555Z","cooked":"

I know this has been a point of discussion previously, but I wanted to see what CD thought now that Champs is over. What are the reasons behind “top” teams not using a turret alongside a swerve drive? Is it weight, complexity, size, or just a strategic misjudgement at the beginning of the year? I feel like being able to have your driver fully focus on getting out/fighting defense while a turret auto-aims for you is beneficial, especially at the highest levels of play.

I can see team resources (time, money, expertise, etc.) being a constraint for some, thus I defined it to “top” teams…like 1678, for example, or 1619.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2022-04-24T03:58:09.756Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":84,"reads":1047,"readers_count":1046,"score":674.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":409897,"topic_slug":"why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret","display_username":"Kan S","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":39853,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2637 Technical & Drive Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret/409897/1","custom_user_title":"2637 Technical & Drive Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3050252,"name":"seg9585","username":"seg9585","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seg9585/{size}/1974_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-24T04:04:22.695Z","cooked":"

I actually visited 971’s pit and asked them why they went with a catapult on a turret rather than a more conventional flywheel shooter. The students gave a good response regarding the fact that they put a lot of effort into the catapult concept and liked the results, so can’t argue with that! I know that 971 tends to design robots a little more unconventionally, which is fun!

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2022-04-24T04:04:22.695Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":1039,"readers_count":1038,"score":447.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":409897,"topic_slug":"why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret","display_username":"seg9585","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":17}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6078,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret/409897/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":16},{"id":"hugs","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":17,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3050365,"name":"","username":"IanSzalai","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ianszalai/{size}/210636_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-24T11:30:01.356Z","cooked":"

Swerve theoretically makes a turret redundant. Practically, having a swurret is still beneficial of course but the benefits of a turret on a swerve are far less then a turret on a tank drive.

Just on the robot a turret is added weight and complexity. Turrets can add a lot of weight (usually pretty high), plus any additional powered mechanism is an additional failure point. Assuming infinite time and resources, these are the the only reasons I can think to not use a turret.

Even top teams have limited time though, and turrets take a lot of time. Turrets will complicate all related mechanisms, so the time cost of adding the turret is more than just the time it takes to design and build a turret.

(I cannot speak for 1678, but I assume that) 1678 would not have been able to have a highly functional robot in under 2 weeks if they had chosen to use a turret, nor would they have been able to have 4 iterations of their robot by week 1 if they had chosen to use a turret. Being able to have all that time with a complete robot is quite possibly better than having less time with a complete robot that has a turret.

My team has a WCD with a turret so I could be completely wrong on all of this

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2022-04-24T11:30:01.356Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":910,"readers_count":909,"score":352.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":409897,"topic_slug":"why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49699,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3255A"},"post_url":"/t/why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret/409897/3","custom_user_title":"3255A","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3050383,"name":"Griffin Della Grotte","username":"Griffin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/griffin/{size}/5624_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-24T13:05:28.744Z","cooked":"

Our choice to not turret was purely to limit complexity and mass. We knew having a turret would lead to better ability to get shots off, particularly under defense, but with limited team resources we decided to bet on simply aiming with the swerve drivetrain. The aiming is no where near as fast as it can be with a turret, but it was still fast enough to be a negligible portion of our match time. You can even get acceptable control to shoot-on-the-move with just your swerve drivetrain… we were doing it on Einstein yesterday. Having defender in contact with you almost directly translate to inability to aim is kinda a bummer though.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2022-04-24T13:05:28.744Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":848,"readers_count":847,"score":214.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":409897,"topic_slug":"why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret","display_username":"Griffin Della Grotte","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16726,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor & Drive Coach 5940"},"post_url":"/t/why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret/409897/4","custom_user_title":"Mentor & Drive Coach 5940","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3050410,"name":"Tom","username":"Zook","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zook/{size}/252720_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-24T14:23:35.199Z","cooked":"

Data? Here is what I spent my Saturday doing:

docs.google.com

Champs Swerve Turret

Sheet1 Color Codes: Carver,Captain,Pick 1,Pick 2,Pick 3,Division Result,Swerve Alliance 1,<a href="https://www.thebluealliance.com/team/604/2022">604</a>,<a href="https://www.thebluealliance.com/team/1323/2022">1323</a>,<a...

I am NOT 100% certain on my swerve and turret observations. Some teams had no photos on TBA, so I watched matches. An h-drive or mecanum robot may accidently be labeled swerve… sorry.

I was interested in whether robots with WCD+turret did as well as Swerve-only bots. Problem: swerve is pretty ubiquitous in the elims! Second problem: while most alliances stuck to the same three bots throughout, or used a 4th bot once, some alliances seemed to switch every other match… and I was not going to micro analyze results like that. I did mark down teams who did not participate on-field for any matches and excluded them from my biased and imperfect analysis.

Based on some very imperfect and biased analysis and sparse data, I make the claim that alliances with more mobility than their opponents win matches about twice as often as alliances with less mobility win. I define from most mobile to least mobile as Swerve + Turret > Swerve > Turret > None. Again, this is based off of robot capabilities, not actual scoring use (I saw some robots with turrets or swerve play defense all match).

In the end, this seems like a “duh” result. But you can’t go off of gut feelings. Gotta have some data.

Anyone make a list of this for all 75+ teams per division? See which teams made it to elims vs not in elims? I’m curious (but not enough to do the work) to see if the highest ranked teams not to get picked were WCD+turret bots.

Google Sheets","clicks":123},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/should-our-team-switch-to-swerve-drive/408740/48","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Should our team switch to swerve drive?","clicks":2},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/swerve-drive-at-the-2022-championship/410032","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Swerve Drive at the 2022 Championship","clicks":2}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":9}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14980,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4276 nice mentor"},"post_url":"/t/why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret/409897/5","custom_user_title":"4276 nice mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":9}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3050411,"name":"Peyton Yeung","username":"Peyton_Yeung","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peyton_yeung/{size}/4840_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-24T14:24:45.813Z","cooked":"

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2022-04-24T14:24:45.813Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":634,"readers_count":633,"score":191.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":409897,"topic_slug":"why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret","display_username":"Peyton Yeung","primary_group_name":"AndyMark","flair_name":"AndyMark","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/7/2/72db24f824a25ae17c6413b3d02a345e47f060a9.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":59,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14215,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"AndyMark; FRC461; FTC4366/6518/19932/21931"},"post_url":"/t/why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret/409897/6","custom_user_title":"AndyMark; FRC461; FTC4366/6518/19932/21931","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3050417,"name":"Nick Aarestad","username":"cadandcookies","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cadandcookies/{size}/158154_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-24T14:44:27.459Z","cooked":"

Looking at the spreadsheet above, I find it fascinating that this thread is framed as “did teams that didn’t do swerve+turret make a strategic misjudgement” and not “did teams that did do swerve+turret make a strategic misjudgement.”

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2022-04-24T14:44:27.459Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":606,"readers_count":605,"score":146.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":409897,"topic_slug":"why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret","display_username":"Nick Aarestad","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17187,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret/409897/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3050426,"name":"Billy Doherty","username":"DohertyBilly","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dohertybilly/{size}/193099_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-24T15:00:40.452Z","cooked":"

A wise man once said that every team only has a certain amount of “robot points” they can spend in a year, and it’s better to have 3 functions working at 10/10 than 5 functions at 6/10.

Knowing and building to your means was likely the deciding point with many of these teams rather than a strategic miss. Certainly was the case for us.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2022-04-24T15:00:40.452Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":578,"readers_count":577,"score":435.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":409897,"topic_slug":"why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret","display_username":"Billy Doherty","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":19}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19264,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"111/112 Strategy Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret/409897/8","custom_user_title":"111/112 Strategy Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":19}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":19,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3050438,"name":"Crystal","username":"CIM","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cim/{size}/3861_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-24T15:18:38.650Z","cooked":"

Turrets don’t automatically work as well as non turreted shooters. They can work just as well, but it’s not a given, and it takes subtle design effort that is hard to notice. Without attention to detail, you can easily get turrets that, for example, shoot balls differently depending on the relative angle they are pointing (this was a common problem in 2012 for example). There are ways to mitigate this, and the amount this matters depends on the game piece and the game. It’s a complex decision.

Swerve drives were, until recently at least, drivetrains that required both complex manufacturing and complex code to operate. While a tank drive that experiences complete software failure is still a drivable robot, a swerve drive whose software fails can’t really be driven at all. This understandably spooks a lot of teams.

Obviously these were more popular than ever this year, and the trend may continue, but just remember no design decision that increases complexity is automatic.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2022-04-24T15:20:17.744Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":540,"readers_count":539,"score":218.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":409897,"topic_slug":"why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret","display_username":"Crystal","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":11107,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Crystal is me (she/they)"},"post_url":"/t/why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret/409897/9","custom_user_title":"Crystal is me (she/they)","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3050459,"name":"David Powers","username":"davepowers","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/davepowers/{size}/214142_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-24T15:58:01.709Z","cooked":"

Just wanted to chime in here quickly.

After all said and done, very happy we decided against a turret. Our initial thoughts, given how large the goal was, and how we saw our alpha robot(swerve and no turret) perform in those early weeks of testing, we saw no need for the increased complexity, increased weight, and everything else that goes with having an additional mechanism. If we went without it, we could mount all the motors super low and belt them up, and we could have one less thing we needed to worry about on the robot.

Along with these initial thoughts, we felt that a big competitive advantage would be in the rapid acquisition and shooting of the cargo. Turrets aren’t perfect, and software even less so, so our team felt that the added DOF would actually increase the time needed to line up for the shot for us. 973 in 2020 was an example of how you could get away without added complexity and still be ultra competitive. Use the robot to line up as you’re driving to scoring position, be ready to instantly fire as soon as you hit the position. I’m a firm believer in pushing simplicity to an extreme. As a team, figure out what you need, what you can ditch, and then making it happen quickly so you can start practicing. Building simple and having meaningful practice will quickly fill any holes in the robot design.

These are all my just my opinions, but are the points I shared with Citrus as we went throughout the year. Every team is different, with different goals, and it’s important to work with your own team to understand the context of what your personal goals are. If you believe a turret will be an important part of your teams success towards your goals, then do it, don’t let other teams dictate those decisions for you.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2022-04-24T16:02:15.215Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":13,"reads":484,"readers_count":483,"score":806.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":409897,"topic_slug":"why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret","display_username":"David Powers","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":39}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15831,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC6328, Littleton Robotics"},"post_url":"/t/why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret/409897/10","custom_user_title":"FRC6328, Littleton Robotics","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":39}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":39,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3050598,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-24T19:41:47.635Z","cooked":"

Depends what the goal is… Prior to 2020 we thought a turret was redundant as well.

We still have a ton of work to do mechanically and in software to get our bot up to the level we saw from several teams in Houston.

The ability to play through defense/ in close quarters was key in our successes on the field this season. That is a little specific to 2767 (we are often a yellow defense magnet), but for us it was totally the correct call.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2022-04-24T19:42:20.354Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":350,"readers_count":349,"score":100.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":409897,"topic_slug":"why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":17187,"username":"cadandcookies","name":"Nick Aarestad","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cadandcookies/{size}/158154_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret/409897/11","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3050640,"name":"Bryan Culver","username":"BJC","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bjc/{size}/87806_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-24T20:30:53.774Z","cooked":"

My impression watching elimination matches this weekend was that a swerve was great for acquiring balls under defense while the turret was great for shooting under defense. Both actions are required to score balls, so having both robot features implemented well made overall cargo cycling a bit more robust to defense.

In a different game where there was lots of balls available but no safe zone to shoot from, maybe a skidsteer + turret would be amazing. Conversely, if there were minimal game objects or tight spaces to drive through but large safe zones to shoot from, maybe a swerve + fixed shooter would be amazing.

In 2022, the combo of minimal game objects + minimal safe zone + tight spaces (under hangar, between hub and wall, etc) enabled the turret and swerve redundant dofs to add more value than they otherwise might have in a different game.

Combine all that with the 1 worlds significantly upping the skill level of the 3rd robot on every elimination alliance, and as a result the defense was extremely strong. The more capable the defense, the more valuable the edge from redundant dofs becomes. In a split 2 worlds situation, it’s possible that the edge from turret+swerve doesn’t manifest in the same way due to overall less capable defense being played.

Cheers,
Bryan

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2022-04-24T20:42:36.953Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":315,"readers_count":314,"score":238.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":409897,"topic_slug":"why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret","display_username":"Bryan Culver","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":10}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/why-did-top-teams-not-do-swerve-turret/409897/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":10}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":10,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3050690,"name":"Stewart Riley","username":"Strategic","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strategic/{size}/10157_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-24T20:59:51.476Z","cooked":"

Though we by no measure qualify as a “top team” (we ended up 40th in Roebling division) I can speak to why teams might not choose a turret with swerve drive. First, we made the same consideration that a lot of teams made, which is that a turret is unnecessary with swerve. Second, as some have already noted, we eliminated it as a possibly redundant failure point and one that added weight higher up on the robot when we were trying to limit that. Finally, and this was a very important consideration for us and (I suspect) for many other teams, it would have limited and interfered with our method of climbing. As it was, we could construct a very robust and successful traversal climb mechanism while still being able to effectively intake and shoot cargo. Mind you, this was after we’d put a lot of work into developing a good turret design in the off-season. But we put tat aside when the design necessities demanded it and went with a fixed shooter instead.
